details: P0 data foundation ticket. Exports existing DuckDB tables as Parquet for browser-side consumption. No new data creation — repackaging existing analytics for the paid artifact. Directly enables The Research Desk premium feature.

data_summary.title: Export Parquet + View DDL Pipeline
Export Parquet + View DDL Pipeline

details: P0 runtime foundation. DuckDB-WASM enables client-side SQL execution — core architecture for The Research Desk. No server-side cost, no data egress. Premium differentiator that no free cricket resource offers.

data_summary.title: DuckDB-WASM Integration
DuckDB-WASM Integration

details: P0 user-facing core. The SQL editor is the primary interaction surface of The Research Desk. Syntax highlighting, results table, query history — essential UX for power users exploring IPL data.

data_summary.title: SQL Editor & Results Panel
SQL Editor & Results Panel

details: P1 discoverability feature. Schema browser lets users explore 15 tables and 52 views without writing SQL first. Lowers barrier to entry and increases engagement with the dataset. Directly improves the paid artifact.

data_summary.title: Schema Browser Panel
Schema Browser Panel

details: P1 engagement feature. Curated example queries showcase the depth of our analytics and serve as templates for user exploration. Demonstrates unique value of the 52-view analytics engine. Stephen Curry + Andy Flower ensure cricket and statistical accuracy.

data_summary.title: Example Queries Gallery
Example Queries Gallery

details: P1 premium AI feature. Natural language to SQL with Andy Flower cricket insights is the headline differentiator. User-supplied API key means zero cost to us. LLM usage approved — client-side only, no server dependency. Graceful fallback ensures feature works without API key.

data_summary.title: Natural Language Query Engine
Natural Language Query Engine
